newsitem.title: USA: At least 15 killed in Texas tornadoes.
newsitem.headline: At least 15 killed in Texas tornadoes.

text.p: At least 15 people were killed and scores more injured on Tuesday when a string of tornadoes and powerful storms ripped through central Texas, police said.
Richard Elliot, the chief deputy sheriff for Williamson County, said at least 14 people were killed by one tornado in and around the small town of Jarrell.
"We've got 14 confirmed dead," Elliot told reporters at a rural community of mobile homes which was obliterated by the tornado. "We've got nothing left except piles of debris."
Rescue workers tried to find victims and survivors in the rubble of between 50 and 75 homes and trailer homes flattened when the tornado roared through about 3:45 p.m. (4:45 EDT) (2045 GMT).
Dozens of cars and trucks were torn into bits, their twisted parts lying in ditches, on open ground or entangled in the wreckage of nearby homes.
Several tornadoes were reported between the cities of Waco and Austin during the afternoon and officials said one person drowned in flash flooding in Austin.
